column4: you should be able to tell the server what passive port to use and then open those ports on your router
port range I mean not port
I did that in vsftpd config file, and I forwarded them, but I still get the a connection refused error
did you forward the port range in your router to your ftp server?
my config file is in this thread: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?p=10047834#post10047834
yes
Is the server itself firewalled?
normally, but I disabled it.  and the ftp works over LAN.
you probably need to set the pasv_address
I tried that, I get the same "connection refused" error.  :-/
it isnt in the config file you gave before, did you add it afterwards?
yeah, I added it after.  It is commented out in the config file cause I had been experimenting with it.
I can login into the server, it is just the data port(s) that are screwed up.
If it is working inside the lan it really points to a problem either with the pasv_address setting or the router forwarding - beyond that Idunno
I think it is the router forwarding, but I have forwarded the pasv port range I specified in the config file.  I cant think of what might be wrong.
What have you got set as pasv_address now?
my external IP -- 71.174.117.120
Sorry, I've run out of ideas! If the router settings are correct and your IP is correct and you can connect inside the lan then it ought to work :|
well LAN does work as long as I dont set the pasv address cause then it uses my lan ip.  ick, I suppose I will figure it out eventually.  thanks for your help :)
you want me to try and connect to it?
sure.  Can I PM you the temporarly password to my blog user?
sure
